byline.contributor: Ian Lovett reported from Los Angeles, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By IAN LOVETT and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Ouster of San Francisco Police Chief Gregory P Suhr by Mayor Ed Lee follows pattern set by events in Chicago and Baltimore, where police officials who were widely acknowledged as moving policies on use of force in right direction have nevertheless been asked to step down following officer-involved shootings and killings.
lead_paragraph: Law enforcement leaders in Baltimore and Chicago are among those who have been replaced after unrest over shootings or other uses of force by officers.

headline.main: San Francisco Police Chief’s Ouster Mirrors Moves in Other Cities
headline.print_headline: San Francisco Police Chief’s Ouster Mirrors Moves in Other Cities

snippet: Law enforcement leaders in Baltimore and Chicago are among those who have been replaced after unrest over shootings or other uses of force by officers.
